title: Support from secrets/config map created with literal data in quarkus-kubernetes
body:
### Description

The documentation of `quarkus-kubernetes-config` understands the following types of ConfigMaps and Secrets as input sources:
- ConfigMaps and Secrets that contain literal data
- ConfigMaps and Secrets created from files named application.properties, application.yaml or application.yml

However the `quarkus-kubernetes` extension does not behave the same so if as example, a Secrets that contain literal data is configured via the `quarkus.kubernetes.app-secret=foo`, then any related entry is available to application.


### Implementation ideas

Quarkus should leverage SmallRye's [filesystem-config-source]( https://smallrye.io/docs/smallrye-config/config-sources/config-sources.html#filesystem-config-source) as described in the  [configmap](https://github.com/smallrye/smallrye-config/blob/main/examples/configmap/README.adoc) example.
